summary: Frontend testing for invoicing app UX improvements. Admin Quick Reference guide is visible and working. Price input race condition fix is implemented in code. Backend database schema issues prevent full order creation/listing testing.

critical.issue: Database schema mismatch - column 'isDeleted' does not exist in orders table
Database schema mismatch - column 'placeOfSupply' does not exist in orders table

integration_issues.issue: Cannot create orders due to backend database schema issues

issues: React warning: Invalid prop 'error' of type 'string' supplied to TextField, expected 'boolean'

action_items: CRITICAL: Run database migrations to add missing columns (isDeleted, placeOfSupply, etc.) to orders table
Fix CreateProduct component - change error prop from string to boolean for TextField components
critical_code_review_comments: Admin Quick Reference guide (lines 1433-1459 in create.jsx) is properly implemented with shortcuts and price protection rules
Price input race condition fix is implemented using localPrice state with debounced Formik updates (lines 419-427, 867-960)
Orders auto-refetch logic is in place in orders.js (lines 51-70) and list.jsx (lines 78-93)
Database schema in order.js model includes isDeleted and placeOfSupply but these columns don't exist in actual database - needs migration
seed_data_creation: Created 2 test products: 'Test Product' (WEIGHTED, price 250) and 'Simple Item' (NON-WEIGHTED, price 100)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Backend has critical database schema issues. The orders table is missing columns: isDeleted, placeOfSupply, and possibly others. The model defines these columns but they don't exist in the actual PostgreSQL database. Need to run Sequelize migrations or sync. Frontend features (Admin Quick Reference, price input race condition fix, auto-refetch) appear to be implemented correctly but cannot be fully tested due to backend issues.
